intro: Voacanga talbotii, commonly known as the African arrowroot or African snowball, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, followed by orange-red berries containing small, hard seeds. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported medicinal properties. The plant's ornamental value and ecological role make it an interesting subject in botanical studies.
